description: A classic Italian pizza with tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil.
instructions:
Preheat oven to 475°F with pizza stone inside.
Roll out pizza dough into a 12-inch circle.
Crush tomatoes and mix with minced garlic, salt, and 1 tbsp olive oil.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over dough, leaving 1-inch border.
Tear mozzarella and distribute over sauce.
Drizzle with remaining olive oil.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until crust is golden and cheese bubbles.
Remove from oven and top with fresh basil leaves.
Let cool for 2 minutes, slice and serve.

description: Slow-cooked pork shoulder with a smoky BBQ rub.
instructions:
Mix brown sugar, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, pepper, salt, and cayenne to create dry rub.
Massage rub all over pork shoulder, ensuring complete coverage.
Wrap in plastic and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Preheat smoker or oven to 225°F.
Place pork in smoker fat-side up.
Smoke for 8 hours, spraying with apple cider vinegar every hour after the first 2 hours.
When internal temperature reaches 195°F, remove and wrap in foil.
Let rest for 30 minutes.
Shred pork using two forks, discarding excess fat.
Mix shredded pork with BBQ sauce and serve on buns.

description: A healthy grain bowl with quinoa, sweet potatoes, chickpeas, and kale.
instructions:
Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
Toss sweet potato cubes with 1 tbsp olive oil, cumin, salt and pepper.
Roast sweet potato at 400°F for 20 minutes.
Drain and rinse chickpeas, then roast alongside sweet potato.
Massage kale with remaining olive oil until softened.
Whisk tahini with lemon juice and water to create dressing.
Divide quinoa between two bowls.
Top with roasted sweet potato, chickpeas, and kale.
Slice avocado and arrange on top.
Drizzle with tahini dressing and serve.

description: Layered pasta with beef, ricotta, mozzarella, and marinara sauce.
instructions:
Brown ground beef with minced garlic in a large pan.
Add marinara sauce to beef and simmer for 15 minutes.
Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions.
Mix ricotta, egg, half the parmesan, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Spread thin layer of meat sauce in 9x13 inch baking dish.
Layer: noodles, ricotta mixture, meat sauce, mozzarella.
Repeat layers twice more.
Top final layer with remaining mozzarella and parmesan.
Cover with foil and bake at 375°F for 45 minutes.
Remove foil, bake 15 more minutes until bubbly.
Let rest 10 minutes before serving.

description: A fragrant Thai curry with chicken, coconut milk, and vegetables.
instructions:
Heat 3 tbsp coconut milk in wok over medium-high heat.
Add green curry paste and fry for 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add chicken and cook until no longer pink.
Pour in remaining coconut milk and bring to simmer.
Add bamboo shoots, sliced bell pepper, and green beans.
Stir in fish sauce and palm sugar.
Simmer for 15 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Tear Thai basil and stir through curry.
Squeeze lime juice over curry.
Serve with jasmine rice.

description: A fresh Greek salad topped with grilled chicken breast.
instructions:
Season chicken breasts with oregano, salt, and pepper.
Grill chicken for 6-7 minutes per side until cooked through.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice.
Combine tomatoes, cucumber, red onion in large bowl.
Add olives and crumbled feta cheese.
Whisk olive oil, vinegar, and remaining oregano for dressing.
Pour dressing over salad and toss gently.
Top salad with sliced grilled chicken.
Serve immediately.

description: Rich chocolate cakes with a gooey molten center.
instructions:
Preheat oven to 425°F.
Butter four ramekins and dust with cocoa powder.
Melt chocolate and butter together in double boiler.
In separate bowl, whisk eggs, egg yolks, and sugar until thick.
Fold melted chocolate into egg mixture.
Sift flour and salt into mixture, fold gently.
Divide batter evenly among ramekins.
Bake for 12 minutes until edges are firm but center jiggles.
Let cool for 1 minute.
Invert onto plates and serve immediately with ice cream.

description: A fresh poke bowl with marinated salmon and vegetables.
instructions:
Cook sushi rice according to package instructions.
Cube salmon into bite-sized pieces.
Mix soy sauce, sesame oil, and rice vinegar.
Marinate salmon in sauce for 10 minutes.
Season cooked rice with rice vinegar.
Divide rice between two bowls.
Arrange marinated salmon on one side of bowl.
Add avocado slices, cucumber, edamame, and seaweed salad.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.
Drizzle with remaining marinade and serve.

recipe_name: Beef Tacos with Pico de Gallo
description: Seasoned beef tacos topped with fresh pico de gallo.
instructions:
Brown ground beef in skillet over medium-high heat.
Add cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper to beef.
Cook for 8-10 minutes until fully cooked.
Mix tomatoes, half the onion, jalapeño, cilantro, and juice of 1 lime for pico.
Season pico de gallo with salt.
Warm tortillas in dry skillet for 30 seconds each side.
Fill tortillas with seasoned beef.
Top with pico de gallo and shredded lettuce.
Add dollop of sour cream.
Serve with lime wedges.

description: Creamy risotto with mixed mushrooms and parmesan.
instructions:
Keep vegetable stock warm in a separate pot.
Sauté mushrooms in 1 tbsp butter until golden, set aside.
In large pan, melt remaining butter and sauté onion until soft.
Add garlic and rice, toast for 2 minutes.
Pour in white wine and stir until absorbed.
Add stock one ladle at a time, stirring constantly.
Wait until each addition is absorbed before adding more.
Continue for 20-25 minutes until rice is creamy and al dente.
Stir in cooked mushrooms, parmesan, and thyme.
Season with salt and pepper, serve immediately.
